name: Cancel Running Tasks and Cleanup
definition: Provide functionality to safely terminate running tasks or multi-step processes, ensuring that execution is halted, all associated resources (such as browsers and remote connections) are properly cleaned up, and a final success or failure status is reported.

name: Collect academic signals
definition: This capability collects academic data and signals based on specified parameters such as dates, topics, or research domains. It serves as the initial step by gathering raw data required for subsequent processing.

name: Convert Mermaid to SVG
definition: Converts provided Mermaid code into an SVG image format, enabling visual representation of the diagram.

name: Create long-running asynchronous tasks
definition: Initiate and configure tasks that execute asynchronously in the background and support progress tracking, allowing for parameter setup and ongoing status updates.

name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Perform structured text edits including find-and-replace, templating, and content transformations using a programmable editor interface.

name: Execute Python Code
definition: Run arbitrary Python code snippets securely in a sandbox, capturing stdout, plots, errors, and integrating the execution results into the dialogue.

name: Extract and Download Paper PDFs
definition: This capability accepts either a JSON object containing an 'arxiv_ids' list or natural language text that includes one or more ArXiv IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs when necessary, downloads the corresponding PDF files, converts their content to Base64 encoded strings, and returns a JSON list of these encoded strings.

name: Extract, Analyze, and Synthesize Research Papers
definition: This capability processes academic research papers provided as plain text with embedded identifiers or as attached PDF files. It extracts necessary metadata and content, performs comprehensive analysis that includes summarization, identification of key insights, detection of trends, and extraction of potential research ideas and directions, and returns a structured JSON report with Markdown formatted interpretation reports.
alias: Extract and analyze ArXiv papers from text

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Academic Research
definition: This capability ingests inputs that may include natural language text containing one or more academic research identifiers (e.g., ArXiv IDs) or specific research identifiers directly. It automatically extracts valid research IDs from the text, retrieves comprehensive metadata for each paper, and applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and semantic analysis to generate a prioritized list of recommended research papers, trends, or findings. This consolidated capability supports robust decision-making by merging metadata enrichment with precise recommendation logic.

name: Generate Mermaid Diagram
definition: Generates Mermaid diagram code for various diagram types such as flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and class diagrams based on textual descriptions of diagram requirements.

name: Generate academic report
definition: This capability synthesizes collected data, interpreted insights, and recommendations into a comprehensive academic report. It formats and summarizes the outcome of the signal processing task for clear presentation.

name: Generate task artifacts
definition: Produce task output artifacts in multiple formats (e.g., markdown, HTML, images) as deliverables of task execution.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: Respond to greetings and inquiries by providing information about the agent's capabilities, available functions, and usage instructions, thus assisting users in understanding how to interact with the agent.

name: Identify research gaps
definition: This capability reviews academic literature to identify unexplored research areas and scientific opportunities, highlighting gaps where further investigation may be beneficial.

name: Integrate Remote MCP Tools
definition: Connect dynamically to remote MCP servers via SSE or stdio, discover available tools, invoke them, and refresh tool schemas at runtime.

name: Interpret academic signals
definition: This capability processes and analyzes the collected academic signals to extract meaningful insights and trends. It interprets the raw data, facilitating a deeper understanding of the researched topic.

name: Manage Long-running Task
definition: Create and manage long-running tasks with features including progress tracking, artifact generation (markdown, HTML, image), and support for task cancellation. This capability enables multi-step task execution and real-time monitoring.

name: Monitor task progress
definition: Track and report the real-time progress of ongoing tasks, including long-running tasks, by monitoring multi-step execution and providing regular status updates.

name: Optimize Prompt
definition: Refine and improve any provided prompt by rephrasing, restructuring, and enhancing its language and structure, including performing iterative optimizations based on feedback to improve specificity, context inclusion, and overall effectiveness, thereby ensuring high clarity, consistent AI behavior, and accurate task execution.

name: Parse natural language query
definition: This capability accepts a natural language instruction for academic paper search (e.g., 'yesterday's AI papers') and processes it using natural language processing techniques to generate a structured JSON query object that specifies search criteria such as date, subject area, and keywords.

name: Process File Uploads
definition: Receive and acknowledge file uploads by extracting file metadata—including file name, type, and size—for display and further processing.

name: Respond to Conversational Text Queries
definition: Receive and process natural language text queries and engage in multi-turn dialogues, including answering questions, clarifying ambiguous instructions, and explaining topics. This capability leverages advanced natural language processing to generate clear, concise, and helpful responses for a broad range of conversational interactions.

name: Review Academic Paper
definition: This capability accepts an academic paper provided either as a PDF file or via a URL. It automatically downloads the PDF if needed, extracts its text and metadata, and performs a comprehensive review that includes structured scoring (e.g., methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance) as well as detailed analysis with summary, strengths, weaknesses, and potential questions, resulting in a detailed review report.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language query to search academic research papers across multiple databases such as arXiv and Semantic Scholar. It processes the query—potentially converting it into a structured search criteria—and returns a numbered list of up to 5 relevant papers. Each paper is accompanied by essential metadata including the title, authors with publication year, source, a truncated abstract if necessary, and direct URL and PDF links when available.

name: Validate Mermaid Syntax
definition: Validates the syntax of provided Mermaid code to ensure it is correct and can be properly rendered.

name: Web Browsing and Automation
definition: This capability enables the agent to perform comprehensive web interactions, including automated browsing, page navigation, search operations, element clicks, content extraction, and screenshot capturing to retrieve and analyze information from the Internet.
